name: DynatraceApi
description: Send requests to the Dynatrace SaaS Settings API
helpMarkDown: Creates a new settings object or validates the provided settings object. Go to https://www.dynatrace.com/support/help/dynatrace-api/environment-api/settings/objects/post-object
author: Hernan Dario Castano Rueda
instanceNameFormat: Dynatrace Settings API - Post an object

inputs.name: externalId
inputs.label: External ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: External identifier for the object being created

inputs.name: insertAfter
inputs.label: Insert after
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The position of the new object. The new object will be added after the specified one. 
 If null, the new object will be placed in the last position. 
 If set to empty string, the new object will be placed in the first position. 
 Only applicable for objects based on schemas with ordered objects (schema's ordered parameter is set to true).

inputs.name: objectId
inputs.label: Object ID
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The ID of the settings object that should be replaced. 
 Only applicable if an external identifier is provided.

inputs.name: schemaId
inputs.label: Schema ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: The schema on which the object is based.

inputs.name: schemaVersion
inputs.label: Schema version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The version of the schema on which the object is based.

inputs.name: scope
inputs.label: Scope
inputs.helpMarkDown: The scope that the object targets. For more details, please see Dynatrace Documentation https://dt-url.net/ky03459.

inputs.name: value
inputs.label: Value
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The value of the setting. 
 It defines the actual values of settings' parameters. 
 The actual content depends on the object's schema.
